result.execSummary:
The defendant Stanley McCray was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Fines, costs, and restitution are due during term of supervision.  Dept of Corrections to collect from defendant's wages and from other monies held in the defendant's inmate account, an amount or a percentage which the department determines is reasonable.  If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

No contact with: TCU. Defendant to avoid the victim's residence and/or any location temporarily occupied by the victim. The defendant avoid contacting the victim or causing any person other than a party's attorney or law enforcement officer to contact the victim. Contact includes: contact at victim's home, work, school, public places, in person, by phone, in writing, by electronic communication or device, or in any other manner. Anger management or domestic abuse counseling or treatment as deemed appropriate by the Agent. Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription. Random testing. AODA and follow up deemed appropriate. Maintain full time work or school. Submit to DNA analysis.

records.addlTxt: Filed by Atty Dvoran - doc for review to Clerk AB  (efiled @ 2:30 pm)

2:30 PM Prosecuting attorney Adam Yale Gerol in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Stanley McCray appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Heather Dvoran in court for Stanley McCray.  Court examines Defendant as to waiver of preliminary hearing.  Court accepts the waiver, finding it to be free and voluntary, and binds the Defendant over for trial.  State files information.  Counsel acknowledges receipt of the information, and requests date for Arraignment.
Arraignment scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.

No contact with: T.C.U. or residence on Main Street in Belgium, WI or any location temporary occupied by T.C.U.  Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription.

1:34 PM Prosecuting attorney Benjamin Lindsay in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Stanley McCray appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Rachel Marie Boaz in court for Stanley McCray. Counsel advises Defendant does qualify for PD representation. Court reviews charges/penalties and finds probable cause. State requesting $5000 with conditions. Counsel requesting to waive time limits and set case for status on prelim.
Status hearing scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
